The bad guys are trying to kill the good guys, but  - well, ok, the good guy and maybe-good guy, but it turns out that some of the bad guys are actually good. Then the good guy(s?) go off to find the main bad guy, meet some other guys and girls, some good, some bad, only to find that some of the good guys, both the good guys from before and some new guys, are actually bad guys! And some others might be too! However, among the bad guys, they find some unexpected allies.

Then it gets really complicated.  But not in a bad way!

If you love twists and turns, double-crosses, plots, conspiracies, last minute saves, peril and intrigue, youve come to the right wuxia. Absurd and melodramatic in the best possible way, this is a headache-inducing overdose of wuxia tropes from Chor Yuen (who else?) starring the great Ti Lung. Colorful, crazy, exhaustingits like a night on the town that leaves you hungover and thinking I don't remember what happenedbut I know I had a good time.

Some will read that and think that doesnt sound like a good time. You people keep away  this is not for those new to what I call acid wuxia. If you want to dip your toes into the genre, try something like THE MAGIC BLADE, or maybe DEATH DUEL. But if you're a fan of wuxia, its a good fix.

Legend of the Bat (1978) is the sequel to Clans of Intrigue (1977), while the sequel to Legend of the Bat (1978) is Perils of the Sentimental Swordsman (1982). Therefore the correct viewing order is to watch (1) Clans of Intrigue first, then (2) Legend of the Bat, and then (3) Perils of the Sentimental Swordsman. Confusingly, Perils of the Sentimental Swordsman (1982) is most emphatically NOT the sequel to The Sentimental Swordsman (1977) nor Return of the Sentimental Swordsman (1981). Ti Lung's character in both Clans of Intrigue and Legend of the Bat is named Chu Liu Hsiang, while he is named General Chu Liu Hsiang in Perils of the Sentimental Swordsman. Ti Lung's character in The Sentimental Swordsman is named Little Flying Dagger Li, and in Return of the Sentimental Swordsman he is named Li Xunhuan. I thought I should mention this to anyone who really liked/likes Legend of the Bat (1978) because it explains the continuity for those who want to watch the related films in sequence.
